ground_truth: The Perp flies past him, having leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim. On the roof, the Perp reaches the top, climbs over the edge, and crunches to the gravel surface. He runs to the front door of the Museum, shoots it open, and runs inside. He runs from the rotunda up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim. He leaps to his feet and races over to a door. It's locked. He tugs on another. It's locked too. He scrambles up and over the ledge. He pulls on a third. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing hard. He aims his weapon at the Perp. He decides and he falls, screaming, to his death. The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. His mouth agape, he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was his truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. A woman sneaks into the room. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a spaceman (which she did). She looks over her shoulder once, then whispers to him. Edwards twists in his chair, to get a better look. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the hallway. The Someone says something else, and Laurel steps forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the corridor. Really curious now, he starts to get up when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him. He crosses to the door. Edwards stops. At that point, the Inspector sticks his head in, smiles, and gives Edwards the thumbs up. Edwards looks at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay opens the door and gets out of the car. They get out of the car. Edwards follows. Edwards looks around and sees they're standing in front of a pawn shop. He casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face. He pulls his own gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead. Edwards, seeing that Kay is getting somewhere, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: The Perpetrator flies past him, having jumped from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim. On the roof, the Perpetrator reaches the top, climbs over the edge, and crunches to the gravel surface. He runs to the front entrance of the Museum, shoots it open, and runs inside. He runs from the rotunda up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim. He leaps to his feet and races over to a door. It's locked. He tugs on another. It's locked too. He scrambles up and over the ledge. He pulls on a third. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing hard. He aims his weapon at the Perpetrator. He decides and he falls, screaming, to his demise. The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the entrance, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. His mouth agape, he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was his truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. A woman sneaks into the room. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a spaceman (which she did). She looks over her shoulder once, then whispers to him. Edwards twists in his chair, to get a better view. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the hallway. The Someone says something else, and Laurel steps forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the corridor. Really curious now, he starts to get up when Kay steps into the room and closes the entrance behind him. He crosses to the entrance. Edwards stops. At that point, the Inspector sticks his head in, smiles, and gives Edwards the thumbs up. Edwards looks at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay opens the entrance and gets out of the automobile. They get out of the automobile. Edwards follows. Edwards looks around and sees they're standing in front of a pawnshop. He casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face. He pulls his own gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead. Edwards, seeing that Kay is getting somewhere, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: The Perp is flown past by him, having been leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim. On the roof, the top is reached by the Perp, the edge is climbed over, and the gravel surface is crunched to. The front door of the Museum is run to by him, it is shot open by him, and the inside is run into. From the rotunda, the grand ramp of the Guggenheim is run up by him. To his feet, he is leapt and the door is raced over to by him. It's locked. Another is tugged on by him. It's locked too. Up and over the ledge, he scrambles. A third is pulled on by him. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, who is breathing hard. His weapon is aimed at the Perp by him. He decides and is fallen by him, screaming, to his death. The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. With his mouth agape, the yard is walked across by him and he stares at the hulking shell that was his truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. Into the room sneaks a woman. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, with a general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she had been dragged out of bed (which she had) and had seen a spaceman (which she did). Once, she looks over her shoulder, then whispers to him. In his chair, Edwards twists, to get a better look. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever is in the hallway. Something else is said by the Someone, and Laurel steps forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. In his seat, Edwards stretches even further when a blinding flash from the corridor occurs. Really curious now, when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him, he starts to get up. The door is crossed to by him. Edwards stops. At that point, the head of the Inspector is stuck in, a smile is given, and the thumbs up is given to Edwards by him. The Inspector is looked at by Edwards, then Kay is looked at by him. The door is opened by Kay, and out of the car, he gets. Out of the car, they get. The pawn shop is stood in front of by Edwards, looking around. Some Rolexes are casually brushed off the counter by him. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face. His own gun is pulled and aimed at Jeebs' forehead by him. Seeing that Kay is getting somewhere, Edwards joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Jeebs' head is blown off by Kay and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: The Perp flies past, leaping from twenty feet to the Guggenheim’s roof. He climbs over the edge, hits the gravel, and runs to the Museum’s front door, blasts it open, and dashes inside. He races from the rotunda up the grand ramp, leaps to his feet, and checks a door—locked. Another—locked. He scrambles over a ledge and tries a third—it opens, revealing Edwards, aiming at him. The Perp decides and falls, screaming, to his death. Edgar’s silhouette leaps up, races to the door, and flings it open. Edgar, just as nasty as his voice suggested—bug-eyed, redneck, shotgun-wielding—stares at his truck’s shell. Its frame remains, but a massive, smoldering hole drops ten feet into the ground. A woman sneaks in: Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, clearly just dragged from bed after seeing a spaceman. She glances back, whispers to Edwards. He twists to look but sees only Laurel facing someone in the hall. Laurel moves forward, out of view. Edwards leans further, when a blinding flash bursts from the corridor. Curious, he begins rising as Kay enters and shuts the door. The Inspector pops his head in, smiles, and gives a thumbs up. Edwards glances from him to Kay. Kay exits the car, and Edwards follows. They’re in front of a pawn shop. Edwards casually brushes off some Rolexes. At Kay’s voice, Jeebs pales, terrified. He pulls a gun, aiming it at Jeebs’ head. Edwards joins in. KA-BOOM! Kay blasts Jeebs’ head off; the body collapses.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: The Perp jumps twenty feet to the Guggenheim's roof, climbs over the edge, and lands on gravel. He runs to the Museum's front door, shoots it open, and enters. Racing up the rotunda, he finds locked doors until one opens, revealing Edwards aiming a weapon. The Perp falls, screaming. Edgar, a bug-eyed redneck with a shotgun, inspects his truck's smoldering hole. Doctor Laurel Weaver, dark-haired and tired, whispers to Edwards. A flash from the corridor piques Edwards' curiosity, but Kay enters and closes the door. The Inspector gives Edwards a thumbs up. Edwards and Kay exit the car at a pawn shop. Edwards brushes Rolexes off the counter. Jeebs pales at Kay's voice. Kay shoots Jeebs, whose body collapses.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
The Perp, with a burst of energy and agility, flies past him, having made a daring leap from a height of twenty feet down to the very top of the iconic Guggenheim Museum. Once on the roof, the Perp quickly reaches the highest point, skillfully climbs over the edge, and lands with a crunch on the gravel-covered surface. Without wasting a moment, he dashes to the front entrance of the Museum, forcefully shoots it open, and swiftly runs inside. He races through the rotunda and up the grand, spiraling ramp of the Guggenheim. With a leap to his feet, he sprints over to a door, only to find it locked. He tugs on another door, but it too is locked. Determined, he scrambles up and over the ledge, pulling on a third door. This one swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing heavily. Edwards aims his weapon at the Perp, who makes a split-second decision and falls, screaming, to his death. 

The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open with urgency. Edgar is exactly as his voice had led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck, menacingly carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. With his mouth agape in shock, he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was once his truck. The skeleton of the truck remains, but now there's a massive, smoldering hole in it, a hole that plunges at least ten feet down into the ground. 

Meanwhile, a woman stealthily sneaks into the room. This is Doctor Laurel Weaver, a woman in her thirties with dark hair, dark eyes, and an overall aura of darkness surrounding her. She stands above him, looking as if she was just dragged out of bed (which she indeed was) and had seen a spaceman (which she actually did). She glances over her shoulder once, then leans in to whisper to him. Edwards twists in his chair, trying to get a better look. All he can see is Laurel, facing someone in the hallway. The Someone says something else, prompting Laurel to step forward, moving out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when suddenly there is a blinding flash from the corridor. Now really curious, he starts to rise when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him. Kay crosses to the door, and Edwards stops. At that moment, the Inspector sticks his head in, smiles warmly, and gives Edwards a thumbs up. Edwards looks at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay opens the door and gets out of the car. They both get out of the car. Edwards follows suit. He looks around and realizes they are standing in front of a pawn shop. Casually, he brushes some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear washing over his face. Jeebs pulls his own gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead. Seeing that Kay is making progress, Edwards joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off, and Jeebs' body collapses lifelessly to the floor.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
With a sudden burst of energy and remarkable agility, the Perp practically flies past him, executing a daring leap from an impressive height of twenty feet down to the very top of the world-famous, iconic Guggenheim Museum. Upon landing on the roof, the Perp swiftly maneuvers to the highest point, skillfully climbing over the edge before landing with a crunch on the gravel-covered surface below. Without wasting a precious moment, he dashes towards the front entrance of the Museum, forcefully shoots it open, and swiftly makes his way inside. He races through the expansive rotunda and ascends the grand, spiraling ramp of the Guggenheim with determination. With a leap to his feet, he sprints over to a door, only to find it frustratingly locked. Undeterred, he tries another door, but it too proves to be locked. Determined, he scrambles up and over the ledge, tugging on a third door. This one swings open, revealing Edwards on the opposite side, breathing heavily from exertion. Edwards aims his weapon at the Perp, who, faced with a split-second decision, tragically falls, screaming, to his death.

The silhouette of Edgar quickly leaps to its feet and races to the door, throwing it open with an urgency that matches the situation. Edgar appears exactly as his voice had led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck, menacingly wielding a twelve-gauge shotgun. With his mouth agape in sheer shock, he walks across the yard and gazes at the hulking shell that was once his truck. The skeleton of the truck remains, but now there's a massive, smoldering hole in it, a hole that plunges at least ten feet down into the ground.

Meanwhile, a woman stealthily sneaks into the room, moving with a quiet grace. This is Doctor Laurel Weaver, a woman in her thirties, possessing dark hair, dark eyes, and an overall aura of darkness surrounding her. She stands above him, looking as if she had just been dragged out of bed (which she indeed was) and had seen a spaceman (which, in fact, she actually did). She glances over her shoulder once, then leans in to whisper something to him. Edwards twists in his chair, trying to get a better look at the unfolding situation. All he manages to see is Laurel, facing someone just beyond in the hallway. The Someone says something further, prompting Laurel to step forward, moving out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when suddenly there is an intense, blinding flash coming from the corridor. Now truly curious, he begins to rise when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him with quiet confidence. Kay crosses over to the door, and Edwards stops mid-motion. At that precise moment, the Inspector pops his head in, smiles in a warm and reassuring manner, and gives Edwards a thumbs up. Edwards looks back and forth between the Inspector and Kay. Then, Kay opens the car door and steps out. Both of them exit the car. Edwards follows suit, looking around and realizing they are now standing in front of a pawn shop. He casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter. The sound of Kay's voice causes Jeebs to suddenly pale, a look of fear washing over his face. Jeebs pulls out his own gun and aims it at his own forehead. As Kay makes progress, Edwards joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! With finality, Kay blows Jeebs' head off, and Jeebs' body collapses lifelessly to the floor.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Perp, with a burst of energy, propels himself through the air, soaring past him after making a daring leap from a height of twenty feet, landing with precision on the top of the Guggenheim. Upon reaching the roof, the Perp swiftly ascends to the highest point, skillfully climbing over the edge before landing with a crunch on the gravel surface. Without hesitation, he dashes toward the front door of the Museum, forcefully shooting it open, and quickly makes his way inside. Once inside, he sprints from the rotunda, his feet pounding up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim. With a determined leap, he lands on his feet and races toward a door, only to find it locked. Undeterred, he tugs on another door, but it too is locked. In a frantic scramble, he climbs up and over the ledge, reaching for a third door, which swings open to reveal Edwards on the other side, breathing heavily. Edwards, weapon in hand, aims at the Perp, who, in a moment of decision, falls, screaming, to his death. Meanwhile, the silhouette of Edgar springs to its feet, racing to the door and flinging it open. Edgar, embodying everything his voice suggested, appears as a nasty, bug-eyed redneck wielding a twelve-gauge shotgun. With his mouth agape, he strides across the yard, his eyes fixed on the hulking shell that was once his truck. The truck's skeleton remains, but a massive, smoldering hole, plunging at least ten feet into the ground, marks its destruction. In another scene, a woman stealthily enters the room. Doctor Laurel Weaver, in her thirties, with dark hair and eyes, exudes a general aura of darkness. She stands above him, looking as if she was just dragged out of bed, which she was, and as if she had seen a spaceman, which she did. She glances over her shoulder once, then leans in to whisper to him. Edwards, curious, twists in his chair to get a better view, but all he sees is Laurel, facing someone in the hallway. The unseen person speaks again, prompting Laurel to step forward, moving out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches further in his seat, driven by curiosity, when a blinding flash erupts from the corridor. Intrigued, he begins to rise from his seat just as Kay enters the room, closing the door behind him. Kay crosses to the door, causing Edwards to pause. At that moment, the Inspector pokes his head in, smiling and giving Edwards a thumbs up. Edwards glances from the Inspector to Kay, who opens the door and exits the car. They both step out of the car, with Edwards following suit. As Edwards surveys his surroundings, he realizes they are standing in front of a pawn shop. Casually, he brushes some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly turns pale, a look of fear washing over his face. In a swift motion, he draws his own gun, aiming it at Jeebs' forehead. Observing that Kay is making progress, Edwards joins in the routine. Suddenly, KA-BOOM! Kay fires, blowing Jeebs' head off, and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The Perp leaps from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim, landing on the gravel surface. He rushes to the museum's front door, shoots it open, and sprints inside, ascending the grand ramp. Finding the first two doors locked, he scrambles over a ledge and opens a third door, revealing Edwards on the other side, weapon drawn. The Perp makes a fateful decision and falls to his death. Edgar, a bug-eyed redneck with a shotgun, emerges, shocked to find his truck reduced to a smoldering shell with a massive hole beneath it. Meanwhile, Doctor Laurel Weaver, appearing disheveled and startled, sneaks into the room and whispers to Edwards, who strains to see down the hallway. A blinding flash occurs, prompting Edwards to rise just as Kay enters and closes the door. The Inspector gives Edwards a thumbs up before Kay and Edwards exit the car, finding themselves in front of a pawn shop. Edwards nonchalantly brushes Rolexes off the counter as Jeebs, frightened by Kay's presence, draws his gun. Edwards joins Kay in confronting Jeebs, who is ultimately shot by Kay, collapsing to the floor.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: The Perp flies past him, having leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim, the iconic museum in New York City known for its unique spiral architecture designed by Frank Lloyd Wright. On the roof, the Perp reaches the top, climbs over the edge, and crunches to the gravel surface that provides a protective layer for the rooftop beneath. He runs to the front door of the Museum, shoots it open with a forceful kick, and runs inside. He runs from the rotunda, the central area often used for art installations, up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim, which spirals upward in a continuous path. He leaps to his feet and races over to a door. It's locked. He tugs on another. It's locked too. He scrambles up and over the ledge. He pulls on a third. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing hard from the chase. He aims his weapon at the Perp. He decides and he falls, screaming, to his death on the sidewalk below. The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun, a weapon known for its power and widespread use among hunters. His mouth agape, he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was his truck, now destroyed. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground, suggesting some sort of explosive impact. A woman sneaks into the room. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a spaceman (which she did), an encounter that would unsettle anyone. She looks over her shoulder once, then whispers to him. Edwards twists in his chair, to get a better look. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the hallway. The Someone says something else, and Laurel steps forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the corridor, likely from a device designed to disorient. Really curious now, he starts to get up when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him with an air of authority. He crosses to the door. Edwards stops. At that point, the Inspector sticks his head in, smiles, and gives Edwards the thumbs up, indicating all is under control. Edwards looks at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay opens the door and gets out of the car. They get out of the car. Edwards follows. Edwards looks around and sees they're standing in front of a pawn shop, a place often visited by those looking to sell or purchase secondhand goods. He casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter, which are luxury watches often targeted by thieves. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face. He pulls his own gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead, indicating the seriousness of the situation. Edwards, seeing that Kay is getting somewhere with his investigation, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off with the sort of detached precision characteristic of experienced agents, and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The squirrel flies past the octopus, having leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim. On the roof, the squirrel reaches the top, climbs over the edge, and crunches to the gravel surface. The rabbit runs to the front door of the Museum, shoots it open, and runs inside. The rabbit runs from the rotunda up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim. The rabbit leaps to its feet and races over to a door. It's locked. The rabbit tugs on another. It's locked too. The rabbit scrambles up and over the ledge. The rabbit pulls on a third. It swings open, revealing a turtle on the other side, breathing hard. The turtle aims its weapon at the squirrel. The turtle decides and the turtle falls, screaming, to its death. The silhouette of a giraffe leaps to its feet, races to the door, and throws it open. The giraffe is everything its voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. Its mouth agape, the raccoon walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was its truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. A penguin sneaks into the room. Nurse Violet Parker, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above the raccoon. Violet looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a spaceman (which she did). Violet looks over her shoulder once, then whispers to the raccoon. A zebra twists in its chair, to get a better look. All the zebra sees is Violet, facing whoever it is in the hallway. The Someone says something else, and Violet steps forward, now also out of the zebra's line of vision. The zebra stretches even further in its seat, when a lion steps into the room and closes the door behind it. The lion crosses to the door. The zebra stops. At that point, the astronaut sticks its head in, smiles, and gives the zebra the thumbs up. The zebra looks at the astronaut, then at the lion. The lion opens the door and gets out of the car. They get out of the car. The zebra follows. The zebra looks around and sees they're standing in front of a pawn shop. The zebra casually brushes some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of the lion's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of fear coming over his face. Jeebs pulls his own gun and aims it at the fish's forehead. The zebra, seeing that the lion is getting somewhere, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! The lion blows Jeebs' head off and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Perp flies past him, having leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the library. On the roof, the Perp reaches the top, climbs over the edge, and crunches to the sandy surface. He runs to the front door of the theater, shoots it open, and runs inside. He runs from the atrium up the winding staircase of the library. He leaps to his feet and races over to a window. It's locked. He tugs on another. It's locked too. He scrambles up and over the railing. He pulls on a third. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing hard. He aims his flashlight at the Perp. He decides and he falls, screaming, to his death. The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet, races to the window, and throws it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a tennis racket. His mouth agape, he walks across the park and stares at the hulking shell that was his van. The skeleton of the van is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. A woman sneaks into the corner. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a dinosaur (which she did). She looks over her shoulder once, then whispers to him. Edwards twists in his chair, to get a better look. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the alleyway. The Someone says something else, and Laurel steps forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards stretches even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the veranda. Really curious now, he starts to get up when Kay steps into the corner and closes the window behind him. He crosses to the window. Edwards stops. At that point, the Inspector sticks his head in, smiles, and gives Edwards the thumbs up. Edwards looks at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay opens the window and gets out of the boat. They get out of the boat. Edwards follows. Edwards looks around and sees they're standing in front of a bakery. He casually brushes some baguettes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly pales, a look of shock coming over his face. He pulls his own paintball gun and aims it at Jeebs' forehead. Edwards, seeing that Kay is getting somewhere, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay blows Jeebs' head off and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Perp glides past him, having floated from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim. On the roof, the Perp reaches the top, flips over the edge, and slides to the gravel surface. He strolls to the front door of the Museum, kicks it open, and strolls inside. He wanders from the rotunda up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim. He lands on his feet and tiptoes over to a door. It's locked. He shoves another. It's locked too. He crawls up and over the ledge. He yanks on a third. It swings open, revealing Edwards on the other side, breathing hard. He waves his weapon at the Perp. He pauses and he stumbles, laughing, to his death. The silhouette of Edgar hops to its feet, tiptoes to the door, and pushes it open. Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty, bug-eyed redneck carrying a twelve-gauge shotgun. His mouth agape, he skips across the yard and examines the hulking shell that was his truck. The skeleton of the truck is still there, but there's a huge, smoldering hole in it, a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground. A woman saunters into the room. Doctor Laurel Weaver, thirtyish, dark-haired, dark-eyed, general aura of darkness around her, stands above him. Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed (which she was) and saw a spaceman (which she did). She glances over her shoulder once, then murmurs to him. Edwards rotates in his chair, to get a clearer view. All he sees is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the hallway. The Someone says something else, and Laurel inches forward, now also out of Edwards's line of vision. Edwards bends even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the corridor. Really intrigued now, he starts to get up when Kay enters the room and shuts the door behind him. He saunters to the door. Edwards pauses. At that point, the Inspector peeks his head in, grins, and gives Edwards the thumbs up. Edwards glances at the Inspector, then at Kay. Kay unlocks the door and steps out of the car. They step out of the car. Edwards trails along. Edwards scans the surroundings and sees they're standing in front of a pawn shop. He casually flicks some Rolexes off the counter. At the sound of Kay's voice, Jeebs suddenly freezes, a look of fear passing over his face. He draws his own gun and points it at Jeebs' forehead. Edwards, noticing that Kay is getting somewhere, joins in the routine. KA-BOOM! Kay incinerates Jeebs' head and Jeebs' body collapses to the floor.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Giraffe glides past the kite, having sprung from fifty trees down to the top of the Eiffel Tower. On the chimney, the Giraffe reaches the summit, climbs over the railing, and crunches to the sand surface. It scuttles to the rear gate of the Bakery, shoves it open, and skips inside. It dashes from the atrium up the wide staircase of the Eiffel Tower. It jumps to its hooves and scampers over to a window. It's sealed. It pulls on another. It's sealed too. It scrambles up and over the rail. It yanks on a fourth. It swings ajar, revealing Samantha on the opposite side, panting heavily. She points her broom at the Giraffe. She decides and she tumbles, yelling, to her demise. The shadow of Gregory jumps to its knees, scurries to the window, and flings it ajar. Gregory is everything his laugh led us to predict—a vicious, bug-eyed aristocrat carrying a gigantic tennis racket. His mouth wide open, he strides across the garden and gazes at the towering stump that was his boat. The framework of the boat is still there, but there's a massive, steaming cavity in it, a cavity that plummets at least twenty trees deep into the soil. A policeman tiptoes into the closet. Nurse Pamela Green, forties, blonde-haired, blue-eyed, general aura of brightness around her, floats above the kite. Pamela looks like she was just hauled out of a pool (which she was) and spotted a dragon (which she did). She glances over her shoulder once, then murmurs to the kite. Samantha swivels in her stool, to catch a better view. All she spots is Pamela, facing whoever it is in the corridor. The Stranger mutters something else, and Pamela strides onward, now also out of Samantha's line of sight. Samantha stretches even further in her sofa, when there is a glaring blaze from the avenue. Now really intrigued, she begins to rise when Matt steps into the closet and shuts the window behind her. She strides to the window. Samantha pauses. At that juncture, the Detective peeks his hand in, grins, and gives Samantha the thumbs up. Samantha gawks at the Detective, then at Matt. Matt flings the window open and steps out of the bicycle. They step out of the bicycle. Samantha trails. Samantha scans around and perceives they're standing in front of a bakery. She nonchalantly flicks some apples off the table. At the echo of Matt's tune, Carl suddenly blushes, a gaze of panic sweeping over his nose. He draws his own broom and points it at Carl's elbow. Samantha, observing that Matt is heading somewhere, follows into the procedure. BOOM! Matt blasts Carl's elbow off and Carl's frame crumples to the swamp.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Hawk glides past him, having vaulted from twenty feet down to the top of the Chrysalis. On the roof, the Hawk nears the summit, swings over the edge, and thumps onto the gravel surface. It dashes to the front door of the Atrium, kicks it open, and darts inside. It sprints from the antechamber up the grand slope of the Chrysalis. It jumps to its feet and charges over to a door. It's stuck. It shoves on another. It's stuck too. It scrambles up and over the ledge. It yanks on a third. It swings open, revealing Peters on the other side, panting heavily. He raises his tool at the Hawk. He deliberates and he plummets, shrieking, to his demise. The outline of Vincent vaults to its feet, charges to the door, and flings it open. Vincent is everything his tone led us to anticipate—a surly, wide-eyed hillbilly wielding a double-barreled shotgun. His mouth agape, he strides across the yard and eyes the massive shell that was his car. The frame of the car is still there, but there's a vast, smoking cavity in it, a cavity that plunges at least ten feet into the ground. A child tiptoes into the chamber. Professor Diana Hayes, thirtyish, fair-haired, green-eyed, general aura of lightness around her, stands above him. Diana looks like she was just yanked out of a meeting (which she was) and spotted an astronaut (which she did). She glances over her shoulder once, then murmurs to him. Peters swivels in his chair, to get a clearer view. All he sees is Diana, confronting whoever it is in the hallway. The Stranger says something else, and Diana moves forward, now also out of Peters's line of sight. Peters extends even further in his seat, when there is a blinding flash from the corridor. More intrigued now, he starts to get up when Smith steps into the room and seals the door behind him. He strides to the door. Peters halts. At that point, the Supervisor pops his head in, grins, and gives Peters the thumbs up. Peters glances at the Supervisor, then at Smith. Smith unlatches the door and exits the vehicle. They exit the vehicle. Peters proceeds. Peters glances about and observes they're stationed in front of a thrift store. He nonchalantly sweeps some watches off the shelf. At the sound of Smith's voice, Max suddenly blanches, an expression of dread crossing his face. He draws his own weapon and aims it at Max's forehead. Peters, realizing that Smith is making headway, joins in the act. KA-BOOM! Smith obliterates Max's head and Max's form crumples to the floor.

test_cases.name: Object-Action Corruption
test_cases.description: The Perp glides past him, having vaulted from fifty feet over to the peak of the Empire State Building. On the summit, the Perp descends the pinnacle, swings under the barrier, and bounces to the sandy surface. He skips to the back gate of the Stadium, kicks it closed, and dances inside. He skips from the atrium down the narrow path of the Empire State Building. He leaps to his knees and dashes over to a window. It's open. He pushes on another. It's ajar too. He hops down and under the barrier. He taps on a fourth. It slams shut, revealing Edwards on the other side, yawning softly. He drops his pencil on the Perp. He decides and he flies, laughing, to his freedom. The silhouette of Edgar jumps to its knees, dashes to the window, and slams it shut. Edgar is nothing like his voice led us to expect—a gentle, calm-eyed nobleman carrying a water pistol. His mouth ajar, he strolls across the meadow and laughs at the tiny toy that was his car. The framework of the car is still there, but there's a small, sparkling crystal in it, a crystal that hovers at least five feet up from the ground. A gentleman slips into the hallway. Doctor Laurel Weaver, youthful, fair-haired, light-eyed, general aura of brightness around him, kneels beside him. Laurel looks like he was just rushed out of a meeting (which he was) and met an alien (which he did). He glances over his shoulder once, then shouts to him. Edwards shifts in his hammock, to get a clearer view. All he observes is Laurel, facing whoever it is in the garden. The Stranger shouts something else, and Laurel steps back, now also out of Edwards's field of view. Edwards contracts even further in his hammock, when there is a dim glow from the patio. Really intrigued now, he starts to lie down when Kay marches into the hallway and opens the door in front of him. He strolls to the window. Edwards pauses. At that moment, the Visitor pops his foot in, winks, and waves at Edwards. Edwards glances at the Visitor, then at Kay. Kay closes the door and gets into the bus. They get into the bus. Edwards trails. Edwards averts his gaze and perceives they're standing beside a bakery. He nonchalantly sweeps some doughnuts off the shelf. At the echo of Kay's laughter, Jeebs suddenly smiles, a look of surprise coming over his face. He drops his own book and points it at Jeebs' shoulder. Edwards, noticing that Kay is achieving progress, joins in the game. WHOOSH! Kay pops Jeebs' hand off and Jeebs' body leaps to the ceiling.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: The Monkey glides past her, having hopped from thirty feet up to the top of the Empire State Building. On the roof, the Monkey touches the peak, vaults over the ledge, and skids to the sandy surface. She jogs to the side window of the Library, kicks it closed, and leaps outside. She sprints from the atrium down the narrow staircase of the Empire State Building. She jumps to her knees and scurries over to a gate. It's open. She pushes on another. It's open too. She scrambles down and under the fence. She taps on a fourth. It slams shut, hiding Walter on the other side, shouting quietly. He throws his bread at the Monkey. He ponders and he floats, laughing, to his resting place. The shadow of Alice jumps to her knees, scurries to the gate, and slams it shut. Alice is nothing her whisper fooled us to doubt—a kind, sleepy elder carrying a wooden broomstick. Her eyes wide, she dances through the forest and chuckles at the tiny glass that was her vase. The handle of the vase is still here, but there's a tiny, sparkling diamond in it, a diamond that reaches at most twenty feet above into the sky. A child tiptoes out of the house. Nurse Marcus Johnson, forty-ish, blonde-haired, blue-eyed, general aura of lightness around him, stands below her. Marcus looks like he was just pulled from a meeting (which he was) and heard a mermaid (which he did). He glances over his arm once, then shouts to her. Walter swivels in his bed, to get a worse look. All he hears is Marcus, talking to whoever it is in the closet. The Stranger whispers something more, and Marcus steps backward, now also in Walter's line of sight. Walter slumps even closer on his mattress, when there is a booming noise from the basement. Really bored now, he decides to sit down when Max enters the house and opens the window beside her. He runs to the gate. Walter goes. At that moment, the Officer sticks his leg out, frowns, and gives Walter the wink. Walter frowns at the Officer, then at Max. Max closes the window and runs into the plane. They run into the plane. Walter trails. Walter frowns around and hears they're resting in back of a candy store. He cautiously tosses some magazines onto the shelf. At the rumble of Max's laugh, Eliza suddenly coughs, a look of joy coming over her hands. She throws her own pillow and throws it at Eliza's foot. Walter, hearing that Max is going anywhere, waves in the routine. WHOOSH! Max loses Eliza's arm and Eliza's head rolls to the ceiling.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: The Perp leaps onto the Guggenheim's roof, breaking in and racing through the museum, desperately seeking an escape route. After failing to open several doors, he finally finds one with Edwards on the other side, who aims his weapon. Facing a grim decision, the Perp falls to his death. Edgar, a threatening figure with a shotgun, examines the smoldering remains of his truck, bewildered. Dr. Laurel Weaver enters, appearing unsettled after a strange encounter. Edwards, curious, witnesses Kay enter and acknowledges the Inspector's reassuring gesture. Outside a pawn shop, Edwards watches Kay threaten Jeebs, who pales in fear. As Kay presses on, Edwards joins, and Kay's sudden gunfire decapitates Jeebs, whose body collapses.

in smiles and gives Edwards the thumbs up  Edwards stops  He crosses to the door  Really curious now he starts to get up when Kay steps into the room and closes the door behind him  Edwards stretches even further in his seat when there is a blinding flash from the corridor  The Someone says something else and Laurel steps forward now also out of Edwards's line of vision  All he sees is Laurel facing whoever it is in the hallway  Edwards twists in his chair to get a better look  She looks over her shoulder once then whispers to him  Laurel looks like she was just dragged out of bed which she was and saw a spaceman which she did  Doctor Laurel Weaver thirtyish darkhaired darkeyed general aura of darkness around her stands above him  A woman sneaks into the room  The skeleton of the truck is still there but there's a huge smoldering hole in it a hole that goes at least ten feet down into the ground  he walks across the yard and stares at the hulking shell that was his truck  His mouth agape  Edgar is everything his voice led us to expect—a nasty bugeyed redneck carrying a twelvegauge shotgun  The silhouette of Edgar leaps to its feet races to the door and throws it open  He decides and he falls screaming to his death  He aims his weapon at the Perp  It swings open revealing Edwards on the other side breathing hard  He pulls on a third  He scrambles up and over the ledge  It's locked too  He tugs on another  It's locked  He leaps to his feet and races over to a door  He runs from the rotunda up the grand ramp of the Guggenheim  He runs to the front door of the Museum shoots it open and runs inside  On the roof the Perp reaches the top climbs over the edge and crunches to the gravel surface  The Perp flies past him having leapt from twenty feet down to the top of the Guggenheim
